data.title: BLUE ARCHIVES
data.meta_description: 500 meters underground, in long tunnels, radioactive material is stored. On the surface, a blue forest seems to possess a soul. What secrets does this environment hold? Between past and future, memories and fantasies, the viewer gradually pieces together the history of this burial site. Blue Archives is a reflection on the imprint humanity leaves...
data.text:
500 meters underground, in long tunnels, radioactive material is stored. On the surface, a blue forest seems to possess a soul. What secrets does this environment hold? Between past and future, memories and fantasies, the viewer gradually pieces together the history of this burial site. Blue Archives is a reflection on the imprint humanity leaves behind, in the thickness of time.

The Directors

Stefane Peraud

Stefane Peraud (A graduate of the École des Arts Décoratifs in Paris, he began his career as a visual artist in 2007 after working as a set designer/videographer) / Aram Kebabdjian (A doctor of philosophy, he translated Kant and defended a thesis on Kant and his geography in 2005. His first novel, “Les Désœuvrés,” which revolves around the world of contemporary art, was a finalist for the Prix Médicis and appeared on the longlist for the Prix Renaudot.)

General Informations

Directors : Stefane Peraud

Production Company : Barberousse Film (France)

Year of creation : 2024

Minimum Age : 12

English Dubbing

Technical Informations

Format : VR 360

Duration : 45 minutes (1X12’ + 4X8’)

Number of participants per session : 1

Equipment required

Minimum Space : 2×2

Contact

Paul Bouchard (Partner – Director of Acquisitions & Business development) : paul@diversioncinema.com
